column4: i try echo -e "\a" to make the system speaker beep but I think it might be turned off, how do i turn it on?
its amazing how i see that asked ion here about eery week. :)  #1 thing to try - sudo  modprobe pcspkr
or try the 'beep' command  to have finer controll of beepings.
at one time there was a X bug that some how disabled the ctrl-g and \a beeping. Not sure if thats been fixed or not
i think that 'x bug' is still happening.
i modprobe pcspkr, then beep works. rmmod pcspkr and beep dont work.. the echo \a never works in either case
i saw someone mention this bug a long time ago. last year some time
YES. it does work from the console.
so it seems that X bug is still in effect.
with the modprobe command i mentioned earlier
in the console the \a worked after i had loded the pcspkr module. Nothing makes it work in X.
really old? or odd?  post a screen shot perhaps.
i dont see any image there..
the logo set selected is ubuntu-mono-dark but i change it and nothing happens, if i go and look again it is back to mono dark
